results.title: Super spy: the story of Reinhard Gehlen
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visions of War”.
Investigates the life of Reinhard Gehlen, known as the ‘spymaster of the western world’. As Hitler’s Chief of Intelligence on the Russian Front he secreted himself and his files on the Soviets away, whilst he waited to bargain for his freedom with the Americans. His bargain was accepted and he and his files formed the basis of the CIA when it was set up in 1947. The story is traced from Gehlen’s joining the Nazi Party during the early 1930’s to his retirement on a CIA pension in the late 60’s.

results.title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
results.brief_description: Legendary game worlds and fighters collide in the ultimate showdown—a new entry in the Super Smash Bros. series for the Nintendo Switch featuring new fighters like Inkling from the Splatoon series and Ridley from the Metroid series.

constellations_other.name: Timeless early animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation traces the inspirations and evolution of the Cuphead animation technique and franchise back to the early 20th century and beyond.

results.description: Legendary game worlds and fighters collide in the ultimate showdown—a new entry in the Super Smash Bros. series for the Nintendo Switch system! New fighters, like Inkling from the Splatoon series and Ridley from the Metroid series, make their Super Smash Bros. series debut alongside every Super Smash Bros. fighter in the series…EVER! Faster combat, new items, new attacks, new defensive options, and more will keep the battle raging whether you’re at home or on the go.
description_for_label: Legendary game worlds and fighters collide in the ultimate showdown—a new entry in the Super Smash Bros. series for the Nintendo Switch system! New fighters, like Inkling from the Splatoon series and Ridley from the Metroid series, make their Super Smash Bros. series debut alongside every Super Smash Bros. fighter in the series…EVER! Faster combat, new items, new attacks, new defensive options, and more will keep the battle raging whether you’re at home or on the go.

results.title: Super size me
results.creator_credit: Morgan Spurlock, The Con, Showtime Independent, Samuel Goldwyn Films and Roadside Attractions
results.brief_description: Eating nothing but McDonald’s for one month, Morgan Spurlock discovers the effects of fast-food first-hand. Under medical supervision, he proves by his experiment that junk food does make you sick - and while it is a bit extreme to eat “Maccas” three meals a day, the film shows how American society is making itself unwell by eating fast food in great amounts and that obesity is one of the largest causes of illness and death in the country. The “Super Size” refers to the larger sizes on offer and Morgan makes the rule that when offered a Super Size he must eat it! Winner of Best Director 2004 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Super sense. Part 2
results.brief_description: Imagine being able to experience the world through animal senses, to go on a unique journey into the heart of the animal kingdom. Using recently pioneered breakthroughs in filming and special effects photography, that journey is now made possible. This cassette contains three episodes: “Super scents”: Smell - it is the territorial signal of gazelles, the alarm system of impalas, the aphrodisiac of moths and salamandas. Stil more astounding, it is the sense that guides the salmon back to its birthplace where it travels to spawn and die. “Sense of timing”: A shrew lives its life thiry times faster than an elephant, the body clocks of marine animals measure tidal cycles… this innovative program reveals, as if by magic, the different time worlds in which creatures live. “Making sense”: Draws together the threads of the series and shows how the mind influences an animal’s view of the world.

results.title: Super sense. Part 1
results.brief_description: Imagine being able to experience the world through animal senses, to go on a unique journey into the heart of the animal kingdom. Using recently pioneered breakthroughs in filming and special effects photography, the journey is now made possible. Three episodes on this one cassette. “Sixth sense”: Animals showing special powers have often been regarded as ‘supernatural’ but this film reveals that creatures which possess a sixth sense are very much a part of the natural world. “Seeing sense”: Vision may be man’s best sense, but four-eyed fish which see above and below water simultaneously teach us that our sight is not the most sophisticated. “Sound sense”: Until now, we have been unable to hear the high-pitched squeaks of mice or the low-frequency calls whales use to communicate across hundreds of miles of sea. This episode opens our ears to a whole register of sounds. A natural landmark in natural history filming, this video is an extraordinary viewing experience.

results.title: Super Penguin
results.brief_description: A short film made in a one-day ACMI Claymation workshop where students are taught the basics of stop motion animation using modelling clay, a digital video camera and editing software. They also create an original soundtrack for their film

results.title: Super Mario Bros.
results.brief_description: In 1985, Nintendo introduced the world to one of the most iconic and endearing videogame characters of all time, Mario. Well, Super Mario to you. The red overall-wearing plumber bounced his way into history and pop culture consciousness in the first of many videogames.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

constellations_other.name: Representation of women in videogames
constellations_other.description: Ms Pac-Man is the first famous female game protagonist, but let's face it – she's just Pac-Man with a bow. This Constellation looks at the history of female representation in videogames.

results.description: In 1985, Nintendo introduced the world to one of the most iconic and endearing videogame characters of all time, Mario. Well, Super Mario to you. The red overall-wearing plumber bounced his way into history and pop culture consciousness in the first of many, many videogames that saw him venturing through Mushroom Kingdom to save Princess Peach from Bowser, king of the Koopas.
description_for_label: In 1985, Nintendo introduced the world to one of the most iconic and endearing videogame characters of all time, Mario. Well, Super Mario to you. The red overall-wearing plumber bounced his way into history and pop culture consciousness in the first of many, many videogames that saw him venturing through Mushroom Kingdom to save Princess Peach from Bowser, king of the Koopas.

results.title: Super Mario Bros.
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1993
results.brief_description: Mario and Luigi, plumbers from Brooklyn, find themselves in an alternate universe where evolved dinosaurs live in hi-tech squalor. They’re the only hope to save our universe from invasion by the dino dictator, Koopa.

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

results.title: Super Mario 64
results.brief_description: Being the first 3D Mario game, Super Mario 64 introduced several moves, including triple-jumping, ground-pounding, long-jumping, diving, and somersaulting, which would be used in most subsequent installments of the Super Mario series.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

results.description: Super Mario 64 is a 3D platformer game released for the Nintendo 64. Being the first 3D Mario game, Super Mario 64 has introduced several moves, including triple-jumping, ground-pounding, long-jumping, diving, and somersaulting, which would be used in most subsequent installments of the Super Mario series. The core gameplay is similar to previous games, focusing on jumping, avoiding obstacles and defeating enemies. Since its release, Super Mario 64 has been widely acclaimed as one of the greatest and most important games of all time.
description_for_label: Super Mario 64 is a 3D platformer game released for the Nintendo 64. Being the first 3D Mario game, Super Mario 64 has introduced several moves, including triple-jumping, ground-pounding, long-jumping, diving, and somersaulting, which would be used in most subsequent installments of the Super Mario series. The core gameplay is similar to previous games, focusing on jumping, avoiding obstacles and defeating enemies. Since its release, Super Mario 64 has been widely acclaimed as one of the greatest and most important games of all time.
